# The `ConstantDataSequential` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential">ConstantDataSequential</a> - A vector or array constant whose element type is a simple 1/2/4/8-byte integer or half/bfloat/float/double, and whose elements are just simple data values (i.e. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential">ConstantDataSequential</a> - A vector or array constant whose element type is a simple 1/2/4/8-byte integer or half/bfloat/float/double, and whose elements are just simple data values (i.e.

ConstantInt/ConstantFP). This <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> node has no operands because it stores all of the elements of the constant as densely packed data, instead of as Value&#42;&#39;s.

This is the common base class of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdataarray">ConstantDataArray</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatavector">ConstantDataVector</a>.

Definition at line 587 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### getAsCString() {#a83be107e09b5576cfb2fc5f8cebe56f2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef llvm::ConstantDataSequential::getAsCString () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If this array is <a href="#aecff3ad6cfa0e4abfd4fc9484d973e7d">isCString()</a>, then this method returns the array (without the trailing null byte) as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>.

Otherwise, it asserts out.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef ConstantDataSequential::getRawDataValues () const">
Return the raw, underlying, bytes of this data.

Note that this is an extremely tricky thing to work with, as it exposes the host endianness of the data elements.

### isCString() {#aecff3ad6cfa0e4abfd4fc9484d973e7d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool ConstantDataSequential::isCString () const">
This method returns true if the array &quot;isString&quot;, ends with a null byte, and does not contains any other null bytes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00593">593</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.

### Next {#a5ef86d3a5944e2b31478478a54640ba8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ConstantDataSequential&gt; llvm::ConstantDataSequential::Next</>}>
This forms a link list of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential">ConstantDataSequential</a> nodes that have the same value but different type.

For example, 0,0,0,1 could be a 4 element array of i8, or a 1-element array of i32. They&#39;ll both end up in the same <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> bucket, linked up.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00599">599</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### isElementTypeCompatible() {#afdcd0a1d482f4048baba27f0bc051411}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ConstantDataSequential::isElementTypeCompatible (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential">ConstantDataSequential</a> can be formed with a vector or array of the specified element type.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdataarray">ConstantDataArray</a> only works with normal float and int types that are stored densely in memory, not with things like i42 or x86&#95;f80.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00616">616</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02842">2842</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Protected Static Functions

### getImpl() {#a9a20b607f6fdb3dd6689a3daed25f3cb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Constant &#42; ConstantDataSequential::getImpl (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Elements, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty)</>}
  labels = {["protected", "static"]}>
This is the underlying implementation of all of the ConstantDataSequential::get methods.

They all thunk down to here, providing the correct element type. We take the bytes in as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> because we <em>want</em> an underlying &quot;char&#42;&quot; to avoid TBAA type punning violations.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h/#l00607">607</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/constants-h">Constants.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp/#l02888">2888</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/constants-cpp">Constants.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
